intro: Beloperone mollis, commonly known as the slender beloperone, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Beloperone mollis is often found in rich, loamy soils and is an important component of understory vegetation in its native habitat.
